unstructured_field_rules.section_name: GROUP MEMBER MOVING FROM ONE GROUP TO ANOTHER
unstructured_field_rules.text: Manch will forward this information to the ASM for confirmation.

unstructured_field_rules.section_name: GROUP MEMBER CONVERTING TO AN INDIVIDUAL
unstructured_field_rules.text: Manch will forward this information to the ASM for confirmation.

unstructured_field_rules.section_name: Login: The Central Team Member team logs in to the Manch application using the provided credentials.
unstructured_field_rules.text: Based on this group owner outlet code, the system will auto derive the below mentioned details in a non-editable format

unstructured_field_rules.section_name: Login: The Central Team Member team logs in to the Manch application using the provided credentials.
unstructured_field_rules.text: UB team will select the Group member outlet code from the dropdown. If there are multiple group member leaving from the group, they have an option + by clicking on this option they can add n, number of group members details.
Dropdown Values : Yes / No
If ASM clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown (configured based on UB rejection reasons) and submit it. The request returns to the central team for necessary modifications.
Manch will generate one report for this process. UB team to share the report format.
Bulk format will have below mentioned columns
Based on the group owner outlet code in the bulk file the system will auto derive the below mentioned details in a non-editable format
Once all the validations are completed then system will submit the request and it will be assigned to SPOC.
Group Owner Outlet Code Entry:  The SPOC enters the Group owner Outlet Code, which is validated by the Manch system against the code associated with the generated link.
Upon accessing the link, the SPOC is prompted to agree to the data privacy policy and terms of conditions (same Terms as outlet KYC process).
System will show the Group owner details along with The Group Member  Details that includes all newly added outlets to the group in below mentioned format.
If there are more than 1 Group member then system will show all the group member in the same format.
Dropdown Values: Yes / No
Once SPOC selects the dropdown value as Yes, then new PANEL will open as Group Member Documents.
Assignment to Approver: Once all the mandatory fields are entered, validated, and the request is submitted, the system automatically assigns the request to the appropriate approver.
The approver clicks the link to access all request details and can either approve or reject the request based on the information provided.
If ASM clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown (configured based on UB rejection reasons) and submit it. The request is returned to the SPOC for necessary modifications
If UB approver clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown (configured based on UB rejection reasons) and submit it. The request returns to the SPOC for necessary modifications.
One report will be created for this process. UB team needs to share the format.
UB team needs to provide the SMS format for Group member inbound process.
UB team needs to provide the Reminder service SMS format for Group member inbound process.
UB team needs to provide the both processes report formats.
